title: Government Fund Accountant
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Government Fund Accountant will report to the Director of Finance and will be responsible for performing advanced accounting and financial reporting functions to ensure the proper management and compliance of public funds. This position plays a key role in preparing and maintaining governmental fund financial records in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) guidelines, and relevant federal, state, and local regulations.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Maintain the general ledger and sub-ledgers for governmental funds (e.g., General Fund, Special Revenue Funds, Capital Projects, Debt Service, Enterprise Funds).
* Process bi-weekly payroll in conformance with state and federal tax laws.
* Reconcile employee benefit invoices and ensure proper and timely payment.
* Create all manual journal entries.
* Create all ACH payment files and wire transfers for payroll and accounts payable.
* Create and update all accounting schedules, and payment/revenue tracking spreadsheets.
* Post monthly property tax distribution payments for City and Urban Renewal Authority.
* Submit monthly financial information to URAD accountant in a timely manner.
* Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports.
* Provide financial analysis and reporting for elected officials and department directors as requested.
* Oversee the reconciliation of bank accounts, investment accounts, and other financial records.
* Oversee sales tax collection operations and make audit recommendations as needed.
* Analyze fund activity and ensure proper classification and posting of revenues, expenditures, assets, and liabilities.
* Assist in the development of the annual budget and monitor fund balances and budget compliance throughout the fiscal year.
* Assist and support the annual audit process, including the preparation of audit schedules and working with external auditors in conjunction with the Director of Finance.
* Participate in the implementation and maintenance of financial systems, including ERP platforms.
* Assist with internal controls, policies, and procedures related to fund accounting.
* Provide financial reporting support for grants and other externally funded programs.
* Train and provide guidance to junior accounting staff.
* Ensure compliance with GASB, GAAP, and applicable laws and regulations.
* Other duties as directed by supervisor.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Strong understanding of governmental fund accounting principles and practices.
* Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Excel; experience with ERP systems is preferred.
* Ability to analyze complex financial data and produce accurate reports.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills for reporting to elected officials, department directors, and citizens.
* Ability to work independently or in a team environment as needed.
* Ability to multi-task.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, Public Administration, or a related field or associate’s degree in accounting plus a minimum of 3 years of experience in governmental accounting or fund accounting (local or state government preferred).
* CPA or CGFM certification is a plus.

* Experience with design verification and validation, including the use of statistical analysis.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

description:
This position will be responsible for SCADA and Control planning, engineering design, deployment, and commissioning on renewable energy power plants. Engineering experience with power and control systems, data acquisition and telecommunications required. Field experience in testing/commissioning and/or telecommunications is a plus.

RRC CORE VALUES

Client Satisfaction – understands the goal of always exceeding our client’s expectations  
Employee Happiness – able to work well with others, communicate clearly with coworkers, promote a positive work environment, and mediate conflicts between team members  
Quality Work - able to take ownership, work independently, prioritize workload, and deliver quality results on time while working on multiple projects simultaneously  
Above and Beyond - versatile, flexible, able to anticipate the needs of the company, take the initiative, and willing to go out of your way to assist others

SPECIFIC DUTIES

Provide SCADA expertise on wind, battery, solar and PV + Storage power systems during the design, development, implementation, and commissioning phases of each project.  
Design and deploy wind energy, solar, and battery storage SCADA systems.  
Work with project manager to deliver procurement and deployment plans, timelines, and costs.  
Work with and manage clients to ensure requirements and expectations are clear.  
Manage IT consultants and subcontractors for network security deliverables, testing, budgets, and system completion.  
Coordinate project site TELCO installation, scheduling and manage schedules and owners expectation.  
Deploy SCADA solutions according to timelines and budget. Troubleshoot problems until site requirements are met.  
Program substation RTAC units, and communication hardware using standard SCADA protocols.  
Work closely with the clients team, as well as RRC project manager, and project engineer to warranty a quality system is installed and tested to design specifications.  
Ensure that SCADA systems have been installed per project requirements and tested to meet QSE, CAISO, Utility, and regional reliability council requirements.  
Responsible to ensure SAFETY requirements are met.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Experience with SCADA software programming, SCADA historians, MS SQL servers.  
Experience with Inductive Automation Ignition 7.x or 8.x software a must.  
Experience with communication protocols for base-level devices: Modbus, Modbus TCP, OPC, DNP3, SELFast, IEC 61850, ICCP etc.  
Experience with automation control systems: RTAC programming, Rockwell PLC and Control Logix programming (a plus)  
Experience with automation device integration  
Experience with BESS EMS system (a plus)  
Experience with complete SCADA system project life cycles  
Experience with Power Utility scale SCADA system development and design  
Experience with FAT and SAT testing and documentation  
Working knowledge of Utility Meters, Substation RTAC, Protection Relays  
Knowledge of NERC CIP requirements  
Knowledge of Managed switches, Hirschmans, MOXA, Ciscoetc.  
Knowledge of Power Plant Networking, Security and Firewalls

QUALIFICATIONS

BS degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering  
Minimum 3 or more years of proven utility or industrial SCADA experience.  
Ability to communicate complex SCADA and controls concepts to non-domain experts in a collaborative fashion.  
Working knowledge of the renewable energy industry and projects a plus.  
Familiarity with and able to stay current on SCADA regulations and standards.  
Travel 25%

STARTING SALARY: $75k/year

The CSM is responsible for promoting and supporting customer adoption, utilization and retention. title: Technical Manager
description:
LETA is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Manager to oversee and manage the organization’s technology infrastructure and technical support services. Under limited direction, the Technical Manager will exercise independent judgment and leadership in the planning, design, implementation, and support of critical communications and information technology systems.
  
  
This position is responsible for directing the overall technology strategy, ensuring the reliability of communications infrastructure, and leading technical projects in alignment with LETA’s mission and strategic objectives. The role requires close collaboration with LETA’s government partners, vendors, and internal teams to ensure seamless, secure, and effective technology operations.
  
  
The successful candidate will possess a deep understanding of communications and information systems, exceptional project management capabilities, and a proven ability to lead technical teams in a public safety environment.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead and manage all aspects of LETA’s communications and IT infrastructure, including network systems, system administration, technical support, and related services.
* Provide strategic and technical leadership to LETA’s government partners’ Technical Support Divisions.
* Oversee the design and deployment of complex infrastructure systems to support public safety operations, including 9-1-1 services.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop strategic and tactical technology roadmaps.
* Plan, implement, and monitor projects, ensuring alignment with LETA’s goals for service excellence, reliability, and innovation.
* Establish and enforce policies, procedures, and standards for technology operations, project management, and change control.
* Provide technical advisement to executive leadership and operational partners on current and emerging technology initiatives.
* Develop and deliver technical briefings and documentation to LETA’s government partners.
* Manage vendor relationships and negotiate service agreements to ensure high-quality technology solutions and support.
* Maintain and enhance LETA’s public website and internal intranet site.
* Assist in preparing and administering the annual technology budget.
* Perform other related duties as assigned to advance LETA’s objectives.

**Supervision Received and Exercised**

* Reports to the LETA Chief of Staff
* Provides direct supervision of technical staff and technology vendors.

**Preferred Qualifications**
Education and Experience:
  
  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a closely

related field from an accredited institution required.
  
  

* Minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in information technology and

systems, preferably within the public safety sector or a closely related environment.
  
  

* At least three (3) years of experience leading large-scale, complex database, system, or network projects.

**Certification**

* Emergency Number Professional (ENP) certification required or must be obtained within one (1) year of

hire.
  
  
**Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities**

* Comprehensive knowledge of IT systems, communications networks, server infrastructure, storage, imaging, web technologies, and email platforms.
* Expertise in public safety communications technologies, including WANs, fiber optics, public safety radio and microwave networks, PBX systems, and VoIP.
* Advanced understanding of data communication protocols, network monitoring, and forecasting techniques.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to lead multiple concurrent initiatives effectively.
* Proficiency in Windows, UNIX, Solaris, and networking technologies such as TCP/IP, Fast Ethernet, Gig-E, and Frame Relay.
* Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Proven ability to assess complex technology needs and develop effective solutions.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly.
* Strong organizational and time management abilities.
* Ability to work collaboratively across agencies and establish strong partnerships.

**Benefits**
At LETA, we are committed to supporting our employees both at work and beyond. We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to promote your well-being, financial security, and work-life balance.
  
  
**Retirement Planning**
Build your future with confidence. LETA offers a competitive 401/457 retirement plan with up to 10% employer matching. Our tiered vesting schedule allows employees to become fully vested in their retirement funds within just one year of employment, helping you secure your financial future sooner.
  
  
**Health and Wellness**
Choose the coverage that fits your needs. Employees can select from three health insurance plan options, ensuring the right match for you and your family. We also provide vision coverage through VSP and dental coverage through Delta Dental, supporting your overall health and peace of mind.
  
  
**Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO)**
Take the time you need — when you need it. Our single PTO bank allows you to use your accrued time off forvacation, personal days, or illness. PTO accrues monthly and grows with your years of service, rewarding your dedication to LETA’s mission.
  
  
**Additional Advantages**

* Work in a mission-driven organization making a real difference in public safety.
* Collaborate with supportive colleagues and innovative partners.
* Professional development and continuing education opportunities.

**How To Apply**
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit a cover letter and résumé to hr@leta911.org detailing their experience and
  
  
qualifications. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

title: Student Support HR Coordinator
description:
**Summary**
**Job Summary**
The Ann and H.J. Smead Aerospace Engineering Sciences (AES) Department encourages applications for the Student Support HR Coordinator! This position is responsible for providing human resources support for student employees in the department under the direction of the AES Senior Human Resources Coordinator and in collaboration with the College Human Resources department. This position manages the HR processes relevant to developing student job postings, student hourly hiring, TA/TF offer letters and hiring, GRA hires for AES and affiliated research centers, maintaining student employee appointments (late pay submissions, appointment issues as they arise), running training reports to support compliance, and storage of all required documents (offer letters, HRSC spreadsheets, biweekly timesheets). In collaboration with the finance, graduate team, Associate Chairs, and research centers, this position helps with all student personnel and payroll actions for the department.
  
  
CU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. We are committed to creating a workplace where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.
  
  
**Who We Are**
CU Boulder is the place for aerospace. Our students and faculty are pushing the limits of aeronautics and astronautics research, crafting next-generation aircraft, growing the possibilities of remote sensing, and building space instruments and satellites for orbit around Earth and beyond!
  
  
Our mission is to provide students the highest quality education in aerospace engineering sciences, emphasizing hands-on learning, and to conduct fundamental, applied, and interdisciplinary research to meet societal needs through analysis, design, and implementation of aerospace systems, using connections between aerospace engineering and related sciences. We are home to 56-tenure track, research, and instructional faculty, over 500 graduate students and 1,000 undergraduates.
  
  
**Responsibilities**
**What Your Key Responsibilities Will Be**
HR/Payroll Support for Student Employment:
  
  

* Serves as Human Resources Liaison (HRL) for the department for student employment, and temporary staff appointments.
* Facilitates the hiring of all student employment with AES including the affiliated research centers (AMReC, BioServe, CCAR, RECUV, SWx). Partner with the graduate team and research centers to facilitate all offer letter generating, sending, and organization to the HR SharePoint. Submits hiring spreadsheet to HRSC to ensure all entries are submitted before HRSC deadlines. Partnering with Sr HR Coordinator to ensure strict hiring deadlines are met for all student appointments.
* Research student employee IDs and information pertaining to new hire or reappointment via HCM. Enters necessary information into center spreadsheets for appropriate HRSC transactions. Emails all students with more than two active appointments to ensure they adhere to the Student Employment workload policy.
* Emails new CU student employees the New Hire Form to ensure they are properly set up in HCM by HRSC.
* Tracks all graduate student employee appointments in the AES graduate student roster and appointment request program to ensure duplicate appointments do not occur. Tracks all graduate student appointments in the new CU graduate student tracker.
* Responsible for facilitating additional pay forms (APF) for student employees. List of employees obtained from the Graduate Program Manager.
* Posts all undergraduate student hourly positions in Handshake for the department and centers and maintaining the job postings until successfully filled. This includes dispositioning candidates via Handshake to close out the process.
* Onboards new student employees by requesting I-9 processing and sending resources of how to properly create and submit their biweekly timesheet. Sets up biweekly reminders for CCAR hourly employees to ensure timesheets are submitted by the deadline.
* Organizes and retains files to the HR SharePoint for the following: Student employment offer letters, HRSC Spreadsheets, Overload petitions from Graduate School, and biweekly timesheets.
* Manages all student hourly appointments within the department and centers to ensure biweekly timesheets are submitted and approved on time. This includes sending out biweekly emails to student employees and faculty.
* Maintains and processes all student late pay, non-pay, overpayment, and lost payment transactions with HRSC and Employee Services.
* Partners with HRSC to run personnel reports in the summer for all student employees in AES and all affiliated research centers. Works with research centers to confirm which student employee appointments qualify for termination.
* Handles internal promotion requests of student employees transitioning to temporary staff and temporary researcher roles. This includes internal promotion forms if applicable, routing a hiring checklist, posting the job through Avature, routing the offer letter and HRSC spreadsheet for entry.
* Works with front desk manager to ensure all separated employees lose access from the building.
* Partners with Sr HR Coordinator in handling all affiliated research center faculty addendums, promotion requests, salary increases, and separation and termination processes.
* Runs weekly reports to maintain compliance to all required student trainings within AES and affiliated research centers. Communicates with students via email to ensure trainings are completed. Communicates with supervisors for all non-compliant student employees. Staff and faculty may be added to this workload in the future.

**Data Entry File Retention, And Additional Support**

* Completes HRSC spreadsheets under the direction of the Sr. HR Coordinator and sends to HRSC for completion. Follows up with HRSC representatives to ensure timely completion of requests.
* Reviews and organizes AES HR ticketing system to prioritize requests. Sends high priority and non-student requests to Sr. HR Coordinator. Responds to questions and closes out tickets as needed.
* Organizes HR files pertaining to staff, faculty, and student hires.

**Other Duties**

* Serves as backup to the Sr. HR Coordinator when emergency situations arise that need to be taken care of in their absence.
* Assists with large department events where all other staff members are asked to provide support. These may include department graduation ceremonies, external advisory board meetings, and projects symposium.

**What You Should Know**

* This position is eligible for a hybrid work modality consistent with the College of Engineering and Applied Science work policy.
* Must be available to work during the high peak student employment hiring seasons such as the first two-three weeks of December. Flexibility will be required as hiring deadlines vary from semester to semester.

**What We Can Offer**

* The starting salary range for this position is $50,000 - $56,000 annually. Relocation assistance is available within department guidelines.

**Benefits**
The University of Colorado offers excellent benefits , including medical, dental, retirement, paid time off, tuition benefit and ECO Pass. The University of Colorado Boulder is one of the largest employers in Boulder County and offers an inspiring higher education environment. Learn more about the University of Colorado Boulder .
  
  
**Be Statements**
Be resourceful. Be impactful. Be Boulder.
  
  
**What We Require**

* Bachelor's degree and at least 1+ years of experience directly related to the work assignment.

**What You Will Need**

* Detail oriented with desire and ability to improve organizational processes, using technology wherever possible to promote efficiency.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (E.G. Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and on a team.
* Ability to learn and respond quickly to situations that arise on a day-to-day basis.

**What We Would Like You To Have**

* Background working in higher education or public sector human resources management with progressive responsibilities, including working knowledge of university administrative and fiscal policies and procedures and campus/university organizational structures.
* Demonstrated experience with complex management responsibilities in a work setting that demands high quality, flexibility, and excellent customer service.
* Knowledge of the University of Colorado Boulder systems (PeopleSoft, Concur, Marketplace).
* Knowledge of and experience with a wide variety of computer applications.
* Demonstrated editing skills to produce clear, complete, yet concise job descriptions.
* Strong problem solving skills and ability to maintain strong working relationships with faculty and staff amidst changing circumstances.
* Knowledge of employment related concepts (employee relations, EEO & Affirmative Action, organizational development, job evaluation, recruitment, etc.).
* Ability to interpret complex University policies and procedures, and to take the initiative to evaluate existing processes and procedures, and when necessary, revise or develop new procedures in order to increase operational efficiencies.
* Two years of experience in Human Resources or related academic operations administration. Equivalent combination of experience and education may substitute.

**Special Instructions**
**To Apply, Please Submit The Following Materials**

* A current resume.
* A cover letter that describes how your background and experience align with this position.

We may request references at a later time.
  
  
Please apply by
**July 7, 2025**
for consideration.
  
  
Note: Application materials will not be accepted via email. For consideration, please apply through CU Boulder Jobs .
  
  
In compliance with the Colorado Job Application Fairness Act, in any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

title: Coordinator of Fraternity and Sorority Life
description:
POSITION TITLE: Coordinator of Fraternity and Sorority Life
  
  
COMPENSATION RANGE: 51,500.00 - 51,500.00 USD per year
  
  
EMPLOYMENT CLASSIFICATION: Professional Administrative
  
  
DEPARTMENT: UPC Admin Operations
  
  
TARGET HIRE DATE: 8/1/2025
  
  
BENEFITS: UNC's Career Hub
  
  
To ensure full consideration, applications must be received by 11:59pm (MT) on 06/30/2025.
  
  
Position Summary
  
  
The Coordinator of Fraternity and Sorority Life provides comprehensive support to the fraternity and sorority community at the University of Northern Colorado (UNC). This position advises the Interfraternity Council (IFC), Panhellenic Council, Multicultural Greek Council (MGC), and National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC), focusing on leadership development, recruitment, retention, and risk management. The Coordinator collaborates with various university departments and stakeholders to enhance student experience and ensure the successful operation of Fraternity and Sorority Life (FSL) at UNC.
  
  
This position is designed to provide overall support, training, and management of UNC's Greek life and registered Clubs and Organizations. This position will facilitate organizational development Organizations through the RSO recognition process, RSO funding process, RSO Officer training, Advisor support, program/event management. Additionally, this role serves as the main point of contact for the Engage student organization engagement platform. This position is responsible for risk management, fiscal management, facilities management and student development while providing leadership and direction for club and organizations in a capacity that is designed to provide positive experiences for students.
  
  
Staff members within the Division of Student Affairs are expected to positively contribute to our mission of supporting students in the co-curricular environment and provide an experience that inspires students academically, intellectually, personally, and emotionally. With the diversity of our students in mind, we use a career readiness approach and social justice framework while fostering a culture and climate of care.
  
  
**Job Duties**
40% Advising and Leadership Development
  
  

* Provide direct advising to IFC, Panhellenic, MGC, and NPHC councils and individual chapters.
* Develop and implement leadership training programs for chapter officers, council executive boards, and emerging leaders.
* Support students in goal setting, conflict resolution, and personal/professional development.
* Assist councils and chapters in planning and executing recruitment and intake processes.
* Develop strategies and initiatives focused on retention of members.
* Work with the Director to ensure recruitment aligns with university policies and FSL best practices.

20% Event Planning & Implementation
  
  

* Plan and oversee FSL-wide events, including Greek Week, Homecoming, leadership retreats, officer training, and recruitment activities.
* Work with student leaders to ensure events are well-organized, inclusive, and mission aligned.
* Serve as a resource for chapters and councils in event planning, risk mitigation, and logistics coordination.
* Work closely with departments such as Student Affairs, Athletics, Conference & Events, the Budget Office, and Alumni Relations to enhance the fraternity and sorority experience.
* Develop and maintain relationships with national fraternity and sorority headquarters and local alumni.
* Represent FSL on university committees as needed.
* Create an inclusive environment that responds to today's students and helps make recognized Student Organizations welcoming spaces where all students can find an organization in which to participate.
* Facilitate the planning, recruitment, marketing, and implementation of the Student Involvement Fair.
* Creates, maintains, and enforces all standards and policies for participants regarding eligibility and conduct.

20% Risk Management & Policy Enforcement
  
  

* Partner with the Dean of Students Office to develop and facilitate risk management training for chapter leadership and members.
* Educate students on university policies, national organization risk management guidelines, and harm reduction strategies.
* Support the enforcement of risk management policies through proactive education and intervention.
* Maintain collaborative partnerships with on campus, community, prospective students, and other university representatives by information sharing, outreach, recruitment, enrollment, retention and mentoring activities.
* Stay abreast of current state and federal statutes, laws, and UNC (University of Northern Colorado) (University of Northern Colorado) policies which pertain to the management, support, coordination, and accountability processes for Student Organizations.
* Plans and coordinates the scheduling of all shared facilities with other staff and departments.
* Develops and implements a Risk Management Plan for clubs and organizations..

20% Personnel and Fiscal Management
  
  

* Guide and mentor student leaders within the fraternity and sorority community.
* Encourage cross-council collaboration and foster a sense of unity within the FSL community.
* Train, advise, and support Student Organization student leaders in effective organizational management, the Engage platform, member development, planning, and program coordination.
* Facilitate the Student Organization funding process to support Student Organizations' event planning process and create and maintain accurate fiscal processes.
* Monitors all budgets related to Registered Student Organizations, Councils and Greek Life Budget, marketing supplies, student payroll, and program revenue.
* In conjunction with the Director of Student Activities, provides ancillary supervision, support, and direction to Graduate Assistants, UPC and all club officers.
* Promote student development and student learning through coordinated leadership development opportunities offered through the Office of Student Engagement and individual organization development programs.

10% Assessment and Technology
  
  

* Develop long- and short-term strategic plans that guide Student Organization operations and contribute to the long-term stability of the Office of Student Organizations.

title: Chief Architect
description:
At Automox we are on a mission to revolutionize how organizations harden and secure every endpoint across their organization. To do this, we’re building a massively scalable, cloud-native solution to protect hundreds of millions of enterprise endpoints globally.
  
  
As companies face continually growing threats and a rapidly expanding attack surface, understaffed and alert-fatigued organizations need more efficient ways to eliminate their exposure to security vulnerabilities. Automox is a modern cyber hygiene platform that closes the aperture of attack by more than 80% with just half the effort of traditional solutions.
  
  
Automox enforces OS & third-party patch management, security configurations, and custom scripting across Windows, macOS, and Linux from a single intuitive console. IT and SecOps can quickly gain control and share visibility of on-prem, remote and virtual endpoints without the need to deploy costly infrastructure.
  
  
In this key leadership role, the Chief Architect will report directly to the Chief Product Officer. You will work closely with the senior leadership team to get a 360 view of industry trends, customers’ POV, and Automox’s team and culture. You will lead the design and implementation necessary to tackle one of the largest scale challenges yet to be solved in endpoint security.
  
  
**What You Will Do**

* Influence the architecture and scalability of the Automox platform to support 100's of millions of endpoints in the future.
* Architect and design our cloud analytics platform to be highly performant and scalable to support hundreds of thousands of enterprise customers concurrently.
* Mentor and guide engineers, lead design discussions, prove out concepts through prototypes to release into production.
* Collaborate with engineering and product leadership to set the technical direction and strategy of our product and platform.
* You are a thought leader with an entrepreneurial mindset.
* You drive architectural decisions, plans, goals and strategies highlighting short-term trade-offs vs. long-term commitments.
* Partner with Engineering leaders to drive efficient software development practices.
* Customer value is a key driver to the success of your work.
* Your technical "chops" should be such that you build proofs-of-concept yourself or direct others to do so based on your designs.
* Proven ability to lead and influence large distributed product development efforts.

VALUES
  
  

* Entrepreneurial spirit that embraces challenges and constantly questioning the status quo
* Be willing to ask hard questions with a result-minded outcome.
* You hold a high bar for what is expected of you, the team and the company
* Excellent communication. You know how to communicate up and down the organization. Be it a presentation to the board of directors or a design concept to a feature team. You value clear and concise communication.

Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of leveraging cutting edge technology along with industry leading best practices to solve for challenges that have eluded their peers. You are excited about the opportunity and understand the unique challenges that come with needing to upgrade engines in mid-flight for a highly successful and growing cyber-security company. “Been there, done that” is likely your motto and you are eager to share and apply your experience to the unique challenges in the endpoint security market.

We are on a mission to enable every IT Admin to automate the fundamental tasks that keep their corporation secure. This mission can only be accomplished with a culture embodies entrepreneurialism, accountability and providing our employees with the clear direction and freedom to do their best work. We don’t measure excellence based on how but on the what. Each employee has a value and contribution to the success of Automox. Every interesting company solves essential problems for other people. Sovrn is a Software and Data business that helps Open Web businesses remain independent. We help them understand their business better, operate more efficiently, and make and keep more money.
  
  

* We believe in the freedom and free flow of information.

Through Software products and Data solutions, we help our customers:

* Make (and Keep) more money, so they control their own destiny.

The Data Solutions team manages the end-to-end lifecycle of Sovrn’s data assets, operating a high-volume public API and Data-as-a-Service (DaaS) feeds for B2B customers. They focus on maintaining and evolving the data platform, with a strong emphasis on architecture, transformation, availability, governance, and ensuring critical insights are accessible to internal leaders. As a
**Staff Software Engineer**
, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data architecture, troubleshoot issues, and ensure the integrity and efficiency of our data ecosystem, requiring strong problem-solving skills and expertise in managing data pipelines (ELT).
  
  
**What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Lead architecture design, table definition, metric consistency, data modeling, and implementation of big data solutions and analytics applications.

* Leader for governance of business-critical product data sets within Sovrn’s data warehouse and ensure their readiness for data analysts and other internal business users.
* Architect components and configurations required for data pipeline implementation in AWS and Databricks.
* Architect data pipeline metrics to monitor performance, accuracy, and availability.
* Enable a team to research, implement, and evolve methods to process our data.
* Optimize data processing and data access to business intelligence tools.
* Work across the organization to enable business growth and development through data services and data models.
* Spot and diagnose stability issues and author improvements.
* Lead the developers with the security team to implement and maintain robust data security measures.
* Ensure compliance with relevant data governance and privacy regulations.

**The successful candidate will have:**

* 7+ years of software engineering experience and a passion for learning
* Strong scala and python skills with an expert understanding of backend and data engineering design patterns
* A deep understanding of big data processing environments such as Spark and Databricks.
* Demonstrated experience with data processing using Spark in a production environment.
* Proven experience with orchestration tools such as Airflow and MWAA.
* Experience working in the Cloud Computing ecosystem. We use AWS heavily, but we are open to GCP, Azure, etc.
* Experience with infrastructure as code tools like Terraform and AWS CloudFormation.
* Deep understanding of relational databases, big data tables, and noSQL databases.
* Able to triage, debug, and permanently fix complex and convoluted data processing issues.
* Possesses a mature understanding of the product domain and architecture.
* A strong individual contributor that can define and architect features required by the business and product.
* Learning to apply industry best practices, design principles, and design patterns.
* Executes on defined features of scope to achieve team goals and commitments.
* Sets standards and best practices around team conventions and precedent for solving recurring problems.
* Demonstrates an aptitude for writing clean, testable, readable, maintainable, quality code.
* Experiments and takes calculated risks around proof of concept and greenfield development, ensuring the team makes the best possible decisions when solving problems.
* Can set the standard and dictate the process for clear documentation and application coding processes.
* Desire for professional growth opportunities and to be in a dynamic learning environment
* Ability to efficiently multi-task and to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees to maximize performance, creativity, problem solving and results
* A creative yet analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Quick to willingly jump in and help others when they are struggling with issues.

**Location:**
This position is designated as hybrid, based in our Boulder, Colorado office. Applicants should be able to commute to our Boulder location as required.
  
  
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of accountability impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We expect you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we're looking for.
  
  
**Sovrn Core Values**
: Candid, Customer Empathy, Learning, Scrappy, Second Order Thinking

The base pay range for this position is $165,000 to $200,000 annually. In addition to the base salary, the total compensation package includes bonus, equity, and benefits. Actual earnings may vary depending on the candidate's direct experience, skills, industry knowledge, and location.

The Senior Scientist will oversee the development, characterization, and technology transfer of downstream purification processes for recombinant proteins. Individuals in this role will serve as a technical subject matter expert in multiple areas within process development and will provide technical leadership as part of collaborative cross-functional project teams. This involves designing/conducting laboratory experiments, interpreting results, training/mentoring junior staff, establishing/maintaining project timelines, overseeing project-related client communications and drafting and reviewing protocols/ summary reports. Also, will be responsible for identifying issues that may delay a project and escalating appropriate actions to keep projects on track.
  
  
**Position Responsibilities:**

* Designs and conducts complex laboratory experiments. This may include preparing experimental records and solutions, running downstream unit operations (chromatography, tangential flow filtration, clarification, normal filtration, etc.), sampling and executing basic analysis of process samples (concentration, pH, conductivity, etc.). Documents procedures, observations, and results in laboratory notebooks. Reviews documentation and records assigned.
* Builds collaborative relationships with clients. Leads client updates (including meetings, as applicable) for multi-faceted programs, exhibits effective communication of complex technical information, including in technical documents and presentations.
* Interprets and analyzes experimental data. Provides scientific leadership and strategic guidance to project teams. Identifies solutions to complex technical problems.
* Acts as a technical driver within the Process Development Department by leading the conceptualization/proposal and the evaluation, development and implementation of new downstream technologies leading to process improvements and efficiency of operation in support of downstream process development and manufacturing activities. Supports and may lead cross-functional initiatives. Keeps up to date about the latest research and technology within the field of Process Development and provides updates to team members about changes within the industry.
* Acts as an example for other team members in relation to lab maintenance and operational excellence initiatives in accordance with internal guidance. Assures proper labeling, handling and storage of all chemicals used in the area; assures proper labeling and disposition of hazardous waste in satellite areas; adheres to all safety requirements and follows safe procedures and attends all required safety and health training. Responsible for maintaining training compliance, according to site expectation.
* Trains and mentors junior staff, providing technical guidance, oversight, and resources as-needed to ensure project success.
* Oversees the technology transfer of purification processes to pilot and manufacturing facilities.

* Reacts to change productively and handles other essential tasks as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements:**
Bachelor of Science degree in a scientific discipline with 10+ years experience, a Master’s degree with 8+ years experience, or a Ph.D. in a scientific or biochemical engineering area (or equivalent) and 4+ years related experience and/or training preferred.
  
  
Experience with downstream process development and chromatography equipment required. Excellent written and communication skills for customer service and ability to meet strict client deadlines. Flexibility of hours to support downstream processes. Knowledge of GMPs and biotechnology-derived product regulations.

This position requires extensive knowledge and experience designing and delivering the data architecture and data strategy for a Fortune 500 organization. This role will directly partner with Business Leaders, Data Intelligence, and Solutions Architects that are responsible for innovative solutions and operational support.

As the Sr. Director of Enterprise Data Architecture, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital workplace. **Responsibilities**

* Engage business and IT stakeholders, building relationships while communicating the value of EA and its portfolio of services to create a data driven culture.
* Collaborate and evaluate enterprise business initiatives, providing support with a security first approach to align business processes with security standards, policies, and guidelines.
* Outstanding communication and collaboration skills with multiple levels of leadership, focused on change management, business impact and supporting metrics to drive collaborative efforts.
* Adhere to established internal procedures, policies and guidelines with the ability to document using ITIL and ISO complaint formats.

**Minimum Requirements**

* Must be a US Citizen.
* Ability to obtain a DoD security clearance at the Secret level.
* BS in technical field, or equivalent experience, MS or MBA preferred.
* 7+ years of experience leading Enterprise Data Architecture at a Director level.

* Cloud Expertise: Minimum of 7 years of experience with AWS (certifications preferred).

At least 10 years of experience with cloud platforms in general.
  
  

* Technical Proficiency: 5+ years of hands-on coding experience with Python and SQL.

* Knowledge of AI/ML frameworks and data governance best practices.
* Specialized knowledge in security programs supporting NIST, FISMA, FedRAMP and CMMC.
* Demonstrated leadership in planning/delivering technology projects/services in a Fortune 500 enterprise environment.

* Experience with Standard Enterprise Asset Management policies/procedures
* Experience in Enterprise Architecture Tools, Standards, Policies and Procedures
* Outstanding oral and written communication skills
* Ability to establish collaborative teams with team members across multiple business units.
